newsitem.title: SPAIN: Firebomb attackers target Spanish regional deputy.
newsitem.headline: Firebomb attackers target Spanish regional deputy.

text.p: Hooded attackers in northern Spain hurled 10 petrol bombs at the windows of the family home of a socialist deputy in the Basque regional parliament on Sunday, the deputy told Navarre state radio on Monday.

"I've been attacked before, but never like this," Asuncion Apesteguia told state radio. "They want me to leave Navarre feet first. This was an assassination attempt pure and simple against my entire family."
Apesteguia and three family members were inside the house in the Navarre capital of Pamplona late on Sunday when the attack took place, but no-one was hurt, he said. The house was badly damaged.
The deputy, who has in the past been the target of petrol bomb and graffiti attacks, regularly takes part in silent demonstrations to protest against Basque separatist violence in the region.
